Title: Manuale d'amore 3
Country: Italy 
USA release: 
Released in Spain: 19/08/2011 
Premiere in Italy: 25/02/2011 
Studio: Filmauro 
Director: Giovanni Veronesi 
Writer: Giovanni Veronesi, Ugo Chiti 
Starring: Robert De Niro, Monica Bellucci, Riccardo Scamarcio, Michele Placido, Laura Chiatti, Valeria Solarino, Donatella Finocchiaro, Carlo Verdone, Daniele Pecci, Marina Rocco, Vittorio Emanuele Propizio, Vincenzo Alfieri, Guido Genovesi 


Synopsis: 
Three new chapters of the Handbook D'AMORE by Giovanni Veronesi 3, which this time focuses his lens at different ages of love ... 

"Youth" tells the story of Robert (Riccardo Scamarcio), an ambitious young lawyer who is about to marry Sarah (Valeria Solarino), and his overwhelming encounter with the beautiful, provocative and mysterious Micol (Laura Chiatti) with you will discover a reality beyond time, suspended between quirky characters and irresistible temptations. 

"Maturity". Fabio (Carlo Verdone), a prominent television presenter, faithful husband for twenty-five years, is swept by a sudden and fatal encounter. The intriguing Eliana (Donatella Finocchiaro) is not who he claims to be. A whim becomes for him a tragicomic adventure: will not be easy to get rid of it! 

"BEYOND". Adrian (Robert De Niro) is an American professor of art history, for several years after divorcing his wife, decides to live in Rome, a city that has always loved. Quietly and alone, is treated with a few people, which account Augusto (Michele Placido), the doorman of the building in which they live. Maybe it's the only one who has revealed his secret: seven years before he underwent a delicate heart transplant. The explosive encounter with Augustus' daughter, Viola (Monica Bellucci), alter their quiet life and will live feelings that had long been appeased and emotions that are new to him ... 

The theme of the amorous adventures of the protagonists is an emblematic figure: the driver Cupid (Emanuele Propizio). 

Production notes: 
Third in Manuale d'amore (2005) and Manuale d'amore 2 (2007).
